newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israeli provident redemptions fell in November.
newsitem.headline: Israeli provident redemptions fell in November.

text.p: Net redemptions in Israeli provident funds fell to just 382 million shekels in November, compared with 1.061 billion shekels the month before, the Treasury capital markets division said on Tuesday.

The figure marked a further sharp decline in redemptions from July-September when the funds experienced a sharp increase in withdrawals. Provident funds are long-term savings schemes that invest most of their assets in Treasury bonds.

The Treasury also said that bank savings programmes experienced net withdrawals for the first time this year, with the net outflow of money reaching 201 million shekels. In October, savings schemes drew net new deposits of 235 million shekels.
For the first 11 months of the year, provident funds experienced net redemptions of 12.3 billion shekels, while savings deposits enjoyed a net inflow of 5.2 billion shekels, the Treasury said.
